message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.HC

Reasoning: 
1. cs.RO (Robotics): The paper focuses on the problem of touch-based instance recognition for robots, and employs a robot equipped with touch sensors to collect data. 
2. cs.CV (Computer Vision): The paper also discusses the limitations of visual object identification and proposes a multi-modal recognition approach that combines visual and tactile observations. 
3. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper proposes a novel framing of the problem as multi-modal recognition and employs a self-supervised, autonomous data collection procedure to collect a dataset of tactile observations and images. 
4. cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper uses a learned model to recognize object instances by touch alone, and outperforms other methods on this complex task. 
5. cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction): The paper compares the performance of the learned model with that of human volunteers, indicating a potential application of touch-based instance recognition in human-robot interaction.
